sentence.Network_en: An astronomer can determine the brightness of each star.
sentence.Network_cn: 天文学家能够测定每颗恒星的亮度。

sentence.Network_en: A new star attracted the notice of the astronomer.
sentence.Network_cn: 新发现的一颗星引起了那位天文学家的注意.

sentence.Network_en: Finally one day, an astronomer came to our village.
sentence.Network_cn: 终有一日, 村子里来了一个天文学家.

天文单位-天文单位(Astronomical Unit),是一个长度的单位,指的是太阳到地球的平均距离。天文常数之一,是天文学上的长度单位,在天文学中用于测量距离,特别是测量.

entry.def: An astronomer is a scientist who studies the stars, planets, and other natural objects in space.

auth_sentence.content: The telescope is named after the astronomer Edwin Hubble.
auth_sentence.res_content: The telescope is named after the astronomer Edwin Hubble.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The telescope is named after the astronomer Edwin Hubble.

auth_sentence.content: French astronomer Joseph-Nicolas Delisle improved on Halley's method.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: French astronomer Joseph-Nicolas Delisle improved on Halley's method.

sentences.en: A new star attracted the notice of the astronomer.
sentences.cn: 新发现的一颗星引起了那位天文学家的注意。

sentences.en: Astronomers can calculate when there will be eclipses of the sun and moon.
sentences.cn: 天文学家可以算出何时发生日食和月食。
